text:
hello team. have not yet chimed in here. <@U026E0ZNR> thanks for all the options. It has come a long way. Great work!

I agree with no.1 being the best of them all. 
The clustered texture is the ‘snow flurry’ ?

Missed earlier discussions here, but I guess it helps to see movement? 

_ I think it somehow distracts from the colour changes
Q1: do you have one with it dialed back a lot?

Q2: where are the stages 30 min 60 min etc? 
_Could you point out the seconds in the video please?

When viewing, it is interesting for me to stop the video in those ‘moments’.

It also helps to speed it up for contextual understanding (and it is getting close to looking like the northern lights “)

Q3: I guess the the colours used are matching Ali’s and Matt’s last designs? Or are they only close?

Cheers :snowflake:

Hey <@U0HPGQ4KH> thanks for taking the time on this, all very good questions.

Movement definitely helps to bring life to the visualization, but I agree it could be finessed to be more subtle as it’s still intended to be background content. Have not made any recordings of a dialed back version but can put some time into it and see what I come up with.

I’m currently plugging these recordings into my AE files to spit out updates for the InVision prototype, I can also render a video with the UI components and corresponding minute count to complete the context. Related: at some point soon I believe the All Day builds will include the most recent state of this viz so we can interact in real time with it.

Colors are open to discussion. I’ve worked with Ali to get them to a good spot but encourage a broader discussion on value adjustments. Because of the blending modes used, values are not strictly adhering to stand alone color swatches. I can get more in depth but it’s likely best served by an in person conversation.

Hey Trent. Great answers/comments here. 

Looking also forward to seeing when it comes to life in context. Will see when we are back in the office. 
Looks like the snow will stay all week. Luckily I have means to go to work - will see what others do. 

Stay warm and enjoy the snowy peace.
Hey <@U0HPGQ4KH>, follow up. I put together an in context reference with the minute count up to show milestones: <https://www.dropbox.com/s/nrmgk3ppnipakb7/170111_HazeMinuteCount_01.mov?dl=0>
just know that it has some old-ish UI elements and is sped up about 6x from the original recording so I could actually upload the file with my terrible wifi
<@U026E0ZNR> i love seeing this come alive
awesome to see it in context of the UI - lookin good Trent! :clap:
